consider breaking down your methods into smaller, more manageable pieces. This not only makes your code easier to read and understand, but it also makes it easier to debug and maintain in the future. 

For example, if you have a method that is responsible for both calculating and displaying results, you could split this into two separate methods: one for calculation and one for display. This way, each method has a single responsibility, making your code more modular and easier to manage.
